result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devonte Gerome Johnson

records.addlTxt:
10:18 AM Defendant Devonte Gerome Johnson in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Devonte Gerome Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Prior to going on the record, Atty Hayes advised Court that DE wishes to have new counsel and would be hiring his own counsel.  DE explains why he wishes to hire his own counsel.  Atty Hayes requests a reset of the hearing.  Court allows Atty Hayes to withdraw; however, the Court will not sign the Order to Withdraw until his new counsel has filed their notice of retainer in the next 2 weeks.  State advises there is an offer in the file.  DE confirms address.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.

1:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo and Intern, Dan Moon, in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devonte Gerome Johnson not in court.  Attorney Allison A Markoski in court for Devonte Gerome Johnson. Atty Markoski believes DE is currently in custody in the Dane Co. Jail.  State requests reset and an OTP will need to be done.  Atty Markoski requests a preliminary hearing.  Matter reset.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 10:45 am.

NO contact w/S.A.C. or her residence;  Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on May 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date on June 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:49 PM Defendant Devonte Gerome Johnson by Zoom audio and video from LEC with attorney Annie E Getsinger by Zoom audio and video.  Defendant Devonte Gerome Johnson in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE qualifies for public defender representation.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends cash bond.  Atty Getsinger recommends a signature bond or a low cash bond, no more than $100 cash.  $150.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact with S.A.C. or her residence.  No possession of a controlled susbtance without a valid Rx.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Return date scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
